case_vignette: A 24-year-old woman comes to her physician because of fatigue. She has been coming to the office multiple times a month for various minor problems over the past six months. During the appointments, she insists on a first name basis and flirts with her physician. She always dresses very fashionably. When his assistant enters the room, she tends to start fidgeting and interrupt their conversation. When the physician tells her politely that her behavior is inappropriate, she begins to cry, complaining that no one understands her and that if people only listened to her, she would not be so exhausted. She then quickly gathers herself and states that she will just have to keep looking for a physician who can help her, although she has doubts she will ever find the right physician. She does not have a history of self harm or suicidal ideation.
question: Which  is the most likely diagnosis?

multiturn_conversation.content: You are an AI doctor. Arrive at a diagnosis of a patient's medical condition. Ask simple 1 line questions, one question at a time. Continue asking questions until you're 100% confident of the diagnosis. Keep your questions short and brief to not confuse the patient.  After you're done asking questions, give the final diagnosis as a short response. Do not explain. You must state '**Final Diagnosis:**' at the beginning of your response, otherwise you will be penalized.

No, I haven't had increased hair growth on my face or body.

Yes, I've been feeling more moody and irritable than usual.

The case vignette I provided does not mention any family history of diabetes.
I understand, thank you. Are you currently taking any medications or have any other medical conditions?
No, I'm not taking any medications and I don't have any other medical conditions.

Thank you for the information. Based on the symptoms you've described, it's possible that you may be experiencing symptoms of depression. However, it's important to consult a healthcare professional for a thorough evaluation and diagnosis.
